results.abstract: Israel Shenker article on successful efforts of Dr Paul Saagpakk to compile Estonian-English language dictionary, in order to save Estonian from 'Russian language encroachments'; notes endeavor was financed by $5,000 loan from a former student and grants from Amer Council of Learned Societies; Saagpakk comments (M)

headline.main: Estonian Aims at a Future Perfect; Others Also Fight for Languages Many Obscure Linguistic Relatives Borrowed Money for the Project

results.snippet: The Estonian language has no articles, no gender, no prepositions, not much of a present and only a doubtful future.
results.lead_paragraph: The Estonian language has no articles, no gender, no prepositions, not much of a present and only a doubtful future.

headline.main: Chess Title Match Opens With a Musical Blunder; The Crowd Stands Up

results.snippet: BAGUIO, the Philippines, July 17-- A Philippine military band made the first blunder of the world chess championship match today, playing the wrong music at the opening ceremonies.

byline.original: By ROBERT BYRNE Special to The New York Times

results.snippet: BAGUIO, the Philippines, July 26-- Their names and faces are not well known. They labor behind the scenes. They are there to blame if things go wrong, but they get none of the glory if they go right. They must be pep-talkers, excuse-makers, game...

byline.original: By ROBERT BYRNE Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: BAGUIO, the Philippines, July 26-- Their names and faces are not well known. They labor behind the scenes. They are there to blame if things go wrong, but they get none of the glory if they go right. They must be pep-talkers, excuse-makers, game analysts, alter egos, devil's advocates and, in the throes of crisis, tireless and trusted friends.
